Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[OSMExport.OSM: Select which direction will be north in the OSM file. For example, setting this to West will rotate the map 90° clockwise.

If enabled, the mod will try to deduce which oneway highways are normal highways (green in the default Maperitive ruleset) and which are motorways (blue). Generally works well, but sometimes motorway ramps might be misclassified as highways or vice versa, leading to inconsistent look. If disabled, all highways will be normal (green) highways.
The file name should have the .osm file suffix.
A file will be created in the ModsData directory. This may take up to a minute!

A file will be created in the ModsData directory. This may take up to a minute!

If the file name does not end in .osm.pbf, the .pbf extension is added automatically.
11 makes a small image with almost no details. 18 makes a very large image with a lot of details.

A file will be created in the ModsData directory. This may take up to a minute!

If the file name does not end in .pdf, the .pdf extension is added automatically.

This feature is experimental! It might have graphical issues and other bugs.

If enabled, contour lines will be exported as ways tagged with contour=elevation.

If the contours are not showing in Maperitive, update your ruleset to the latest version of the ruleset linked on the mod page.

Transport lines are always exported in the standard OSM way to export them. However, many programs, including Maperitive, cannot display them. If this option is enabled, transport lines will be exported as custom non-standard nodes and ways that are possible to render in most program using custom rules.

If the lines are not showing in Maperitive, update your ruleset to the latest version of the ruleset linked on the mod page.
